item.title: 加拿大零售销售在贸易忧虑和减税政策影响下疲软
item.description: 在贸易战不确定性的影响下，加拿大消费者连续第二个月缩减开支，部分扭转了联邦销售税暂停后年终销售增长的势头。【原文：Canadian consumers pared back their spending for a second straight month amid trade war uncertainty, partially reversing a year-end boost in sales after a federal sales tax was paused.】

item.title: 爱迪生公司首席执行官说，引发野火需要的不仅仅是一条输电线
item.description:
公用事业公司希望客户补充加州 210 亿美元的消防基金，并表示气候条件也难辞其咎。【原文：

Utilities want customers to replenish California’s $21 billion fire fund, saying climate conditions are also to blame.

】

item.title: 全球风险促使加拿大养老金重新思考 PE 战略
item.description: 安大略省教师退休金计划正在重新审视其私募股权投资部门，旨在更多地依靠合作伙伴关系，而不是拥有整个公司，以寻求降低风险。【原文：Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan is re-examining its private equity unit, aiming to lean more on partnerships rather than owning entire firms as it seeks to mitigate risk.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚与债权人就 84 亿美元债务重组达成协议
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚财政部周五表示，埃塞俄比亚已就二十国集团（G20）共同框架下 84 亿美元国际债务重组的主要财务参数与其债券持有人达成原则性协议。【原文：Ethiopia has reached an agreement in principle with its bondholders on the main financial parameters for the restructuring of $8.4 billion of international debt under the G20 Common Framework, its finance ministry said on Friday.】

item.title: 尽管股价下滑，但对于富时罗素指数而言，大科技公司仍然太大了
item.description: 对于指数巨头富时罗素指数（FTSE Russell）来说，苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：For index behemoth FTSE Russell, the likes of Apple Inc. are still too big for comfort — even after the recent $2 trillion selloff that’s dethroned Big Tech from the stock market’s leaderboard.】

item.title: 爱尔兰总理称特朗普关税有可能导致欧盟在应对措施上分裂
item.description: 爱尔兰总理表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普逐个行业征收关税的做法有可能在欧盟成员国之间制造分裂。【原文：A sector-by-sector tariff approach by US President Donald Trump risks creating divisions among European Union member states, Ireland’s prime minister said.】

item.title: 德国美容零售商发出警告后跌至首次公开募股价格的一半
item.description: 香水零售商道格拉斯公司（Douglas AG）下调了销售额和利润指导，使其股价飙升至该德国公司重新加入法兰克福证券交易所一年来的新低。【原文：Perfume retailer Douglas AG lowered sales and profit guidance, sending its shares spiraling to a record low a year to the day the German company rejoined the Frankfurt stock exchange.】

item.title: 大米价格下滑缓解了新鲜食品通胀压力
item.description: 在鸡蛋价格飙升、咖啡价格空前昂贵的同时，消费者却在食品世界中找到了一丝慰藉：大米。【原文：While egg prices have soared and coffee has never been more expensive, there’s a part of the food world where consumers are finding some relief: Rice.】

item.title: 英伟达™（Nvidia®）公司总裁黄仁勋：人工智能的下一阶段— 让人工智能变得有用
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，伊恩-金（Ian King）从英伟达（Nvidia）的开发者大会上报道了黄仁勋关于人工智能未来的新信息。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ian King reports from Nvidia’s developers conference about Jensen Huang’s new message about the future of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 尽管受到限制，美国的返聘工作仍停滞不前
item.description: 我是驻纽约记者奥古斯塔-萨拉瓦。今天我们将关注美国工人中反对徽章制度的声音。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Augusta Saraiva, a reporter in New York. item.title: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔说特朗普不能解雇他。这可能会改变
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）对唐纳德-特朗普总统能否解雇他的问题一直态度明确。"法律不允许，"他在 11 月被问及此事时说— 两次— 。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has been crystal clear about whether President Donald Trump can fire him. “Not permitted under the law,” he said — twice — when asked in November.】

item.title: 美国银行称关税风险已被摒弃，股票获得 "巨量 "资金流入
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）表示，随着 "怪物级 "资金流不断涌入全球股市，投资者正在摒弃全面贸易战将给股市带来的风险。【原文：Investors are dismissing the risks that a full-fledged trade war would pose to stocks as “monster” flows of capital keep pouring into global equity markets, Bank of America Corp.’s Michael Hartnett said.】

item.title: 俄罗斯将利率维持在历史最高水平以应对价格压力
item.description: 俄罗斯央行在第三次会议上将借贷成本维持在历史最高水平，再次表明它准备进一步收紧货币政策，以应对持续的通货膨胀。【原文：Russia’s central bank held borrowing costs at a historic high for a third meeting, again signaling that it’s prepared to tighten monetary policy further to fight persistent inflation.】

item.title: 刚果向美国提出收购刚果锂矿的要约
item.description: 由亿万富翁比尔-盖茨（Bill Gates）和杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）支持的KoBold金属公司（KoBold Metals Co.【原文：KoBold Metals Co., backed by billionaires Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos, has told the government of the Democratic Republic of Congo it wants to develop one of the world’s biggest hard rock lithium deposits.】

item.title: 伯福特就 160 亿美元判决对米莱保持沉默
item.description: 从纸面上看，这是诉讼融资领域有史以来最有利可图的胜利之一。Burford Capital Ltd.是一家利基公司，当法官就它以不到 1700 万美元的价格获得的对阿根廷政府的索赔作出 161 亿美元的裁决时，它与其他债权人一起中了头奖。【原文：On paper, it was one of the most lucrative victories ever in the field of litigation financing. Burford Capital Ltd., a niche firm, hit the jackpot along with other creditors when a judge delivered a $16.1 billion award on claims it acquired against the Argentine government for less than $17 million.】

item.title: 胡塞武装袭击暂停，欧洲暂时可通过苏伊士运河获得更多燃料
item.description: 胡塞武装暂停对商业航运的袭击后，燃料贸易商通过埃及苏伊士运河向欧洲进口了更多货物。【原文：A pause in Houthi attacks on commercial shipping has seen fuel traders import more cargoes into Europe via Egypt’s Suez Canal.】

item.title: 台湾任命日本前防卫局长为内阁顾问
item.description: 据台湾政府官员称，台湾任命了一位前日本防卫部队司令担任顾问，此举正值两国政府应对中国日益强硬的态度之际。【原文：Taiwan named a former head of the Japanese defense forces as an adviser, according to officials in the archipelago’s government, a move coming as the two governments deal with China’s increasing assertiveness.】

item.title: 亏损散户在市场徘徊之际继续购买股票
item.description: 在贸易动荡和对经济放缓的担忧与日俱增的股市打击下，散户投资者加倍下注，毫不畏惧损失的增加。【原文：In a stock market battered by trade turmoil and growing fears of an economic slowdown, retail investors are doubling down, undeterred as their losses mount.】

item.title: 银行为赛诺菲部门收购启动 74.5 亿欧元债务出售计划
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）和花旗集团（Citigroup）等银行启动了一项 74.5 亿欧元（81 亿美元）的债务销售，为 Clayton Dubilier & Rice 收购赛诺菲公司消费者健康部门的股份提供资金。【原文：Banks including Goldman Sachs and Citigroup have launched a €7.45 billion ($8.1 billion) debt sale to finance Clayton Dubilier & Rice’s purchase of a stake in Sanofi SA’s consumer health division.】

item.title: 葡萄酒鉴赏家因特朗普征收 200% 关税的风险而冻结采购
item.description: 葡萄酒爱好者史蒂文-诺德霍夫（Steven Nordhoff）每年通常要花费约 2.5 万美元来添置他的 2500 瓶收藏，包括来自意大利的布鲁诺-贾科萨（Bruno Giacosa）红葡萄酒或来自法国的维尔马特（Vilmart）香槟。但现在不一样了。【原文：Wine enthusiast Steven Nordhoff typically spends about $25,000 a year adding to his 2,500-bottle collection, with Bruno Giacosa reds from Italy or Vilmart champagnes from France. But not now.】

item.title: 英国石油公司将以 10 亿美元向阿波罗基金出售天然气管道股权
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）表示，阿波罗管理的基金将以约 10 亿美元的价格收购英国石油管道公司（BP Pipelines — known as BP TANAP —）25% 的非控股股权，这标志着这家英国能源巨头在其扭亏为盈计划中的首次资产剥离。【原文：BP Plc said Apollo-managed funds will purchase a 25% non-controlling stake in BP Pipelines — known as BP TANAP — for about $1 billion, marking the British energy giant’s first divestment under its turnaround plan.】

item.title: 美团收入增长 20%，推动全球扩张
item.description: 美团的季度收入攀升了 20%，这表明这家中国餐饮外卖行业的领军企业正在成功抵御新的国内竞争，同时向海外扩张。【原文：Meituan’s quarterly revenue climbed 20%, suggesting the Chinese meal delivery leader is successfully fending off new domestic competition while expanding abroad.】

item.title: 减值减少，中国博康利润增长 0.9
item.description: 中国最大的国有银行之一交通银行表示，由于信贷减值减少，抵消了利润率的收缩，去年利润增长了 0.9%。【原文：Bank of Communications, one of China’s largest state-owned banks, said profit rose 0.9% last year as credit impairment declined, offsetting a margin contraction.】

item.title: 英国 GDP 数据将受到最新统计问题的影响
item.description: 英国国内生产总值和贸易数据将受到国家统计局更多数据质量问题的影响。【原文：Britain’s GDP and trade figures will feel the impact of more problems with data quality at the Office for National Statistics.】

item.title: 资金重新流入，卢比迎来两年来最佳一周
item.description: 受外国资金流入当地债券和股市反弹提振投资者情绪的影响，印度卢比本周有望创下自 2023 年 1 月以来的最佳表现。【原文：India’s rupee is on track for its best week since January 2023, buoyed by foreign fund inflows into local bonds and a stock market rebound that has lifted investor sentiment.】

item.title: 莱维镇发现假裸照引发现实噩梦
item.description:
在彭博社新播客的第一集中，一位父亲有了一个令人不安的发现：他女儿无辜的照片被人篡改并发布到了一个色情网站上。【原文：

In the first episode of a new Bloomberg podcast, a father makes a disturbing discovery: innocent images of his daughter have been manipulated and posted to a porn website.

】

item.description: 金融业放弃谨慎，追逐欧洲股市的涨势，上调目标并期待上行。【原文：The financial industry is abandoning caution and chasing the rally in European stocks, hiking their targets and looking to the upside.】

item.title: 更多内容野村的麦克利戈特谈奇怪的抛售（播客）
item.description: 上周，美国市场大幅抛售。仅周一一天，S&P 500 指数就下跌了 3.6%，进入了技术性修正区域。动量交易受到的打击尤为严重，多年来一直是赢家的股票突然变成了输家，而一直是输家的股票却突然表现出色。不过，最奇怪的是，随着抛售，波动率并没有真正飙升。VIX指数（有时被称为华尔街的 "恐惧指数"）上升了，但甚至没有达到以下水平【原文：Last week, the US market sold off sharply. The S&P 500 fell as much as 3.6% on Monday alone, entering technical correction territory. Momentum trades were hit particularly hard and stocks that had been winners for years suddenly became losers, while ones that had been losers suddenly outperformed. Perhaps the strangest thing though, is that volatility didn’t really surge as things sold off. The VIX — sometimes called Wall Street’s “Fear Gauge” — went up, but it didn’t even reach levels that】
